column40: Reads were pre-processing (filtering, quality trimming and adapter clipping) using Trimmomatic (version 0.38) (PMID:24695404),  then single-end with min 36-bp reads length were aligned to human genome build GRCh38/hg38 using Bowtie2 v2.2.6 (PMID

column12: Isolation of clonal cell line by dilution of CFPAC1 cells infected with lentiCRIPSv2 plasmid (Addgene #52961)
column13: IMDM supplemented with 10% Fetal Bovine Serum, 2mM L-Glutamine and 1% Pen/Strep
column15: 50000 cells were pelleted by centrifugation and re-suspended in 50 µl of cold lysis buffer (10mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10mM NaCl, 3mM MgCl2, 0.1% NP40, 0.1% Tween-20 and 0.01% Digitonin). After incubation on ice for three minutes, lysis was washed out by adding 1 mL of lysis buffer without NP40 and digitonin. Nuclei were pelleted by centrifugation for 10 min at 500g, 4 ºC.  The supernatant was discarded and nuclei were re-suspended in 50 µl of reaction buffer containing 1 µl of Tn5 transposase (made in house),  10 ul of 5x transposase buffer (50mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.4 and 25mM MgCl2), 16.5 µl PBS, 0.5 µl of 1% digitonin, 0.5 µl of 10% Tween-20. The reaction was incubated at 37ºC for 30 minutes with 600 RPM mixing. Then 5 µl of clean up buffer (900mM NaCl, 300mM EDTA), 2ul of 5% SDS and 2 µl of Proteinase K (20 µg/µl) (New England Biolabs) were added and incubated for 30 min at 40 ºC. Tagmented DNA was isolated using SPRI beads (2x) and amplified by PCR. Fragments smaller than 600 bp were isolated using SPRI cleanup and libraries where sequenced on an Illumina NextSeq500 platform.
column17: Peak calling was performed using MACS2 with the “--nomodel”, “--extsize 146”,  “--qvalue 0.05”, "--nolambda" and "--keep-dup all" flags and arguments
column40: 22388286) with “–very-sensitive” preset of parameters. Reads that did not align to nuclear genome or aligned to mitocondrial genome were removed. PCR duplicates were removed using samtools. Then read positions were corrected for transposon insertion offset as described in (PMID:24097267).
column42: *.narrowPeak, list of the peaks called by MACS2
